ccre.igneous

Class IgneousCore

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.igneous.IgneousCore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InstinctRegistrar
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleCore

    public abstract class IgneousCore
extends java.lang.Object
implements InstinctRegistrar
    A Core class for Igneous. Extend this (or SimpleCore, which is easier) in order to write an application to run on the robot.
    See Also:
    SimpleCore

    • Method Detail

      • createRobotControl

        protected abstract void createRobotControl()
        Implement this method - it should set up everything that your robot needs to do.

      • makeSimpleJoystick

        protected final ISimpleJoystick makeSimpleJoystick(int id)
        Get an ISimpleJoystick for the specified joystick ID. Joysticks 1-4 are joysticks attached to the driver station. Joystick 5 is the virtual Kinect left-arm joystick, and joystick 6 is the virtual Kinect right-arm joystick.
        Parameters:
        id - the joystick ID, from 1 to 6, inclusive.
        Returns:
        the ISimpleJoystick.
        See Also:
        makeDispatchJoystick(int)

      • makeDispatchJoystick

        protected final IDispatchJoystick makeDispatchJoystick(int id)
        Get an IDispatchJoystick for the specified joystick ID. Joysticks 1-4 are joysticks attached to the driver station. Joystick 5 is the virtual Kinect left-arm joystick, and joystick 6 is the virtual Kinect right-arm joystick. The joystick will update the inputs and events during teleop mode only. This is equivalent to makeDispatchJoystick(id, duringTeleop).
        Parameters:
        id - the joystick ID, from 1 to 6, inclusive.
        Returns:
        the IDispatchJoystick.
        See Also:
        makeSimpleJoystick(int), makeDispatchJoystick(int, ccre.event.EventSource)

      • makeDispatchJoystick

        protected final IDispatchJoystick makeDispatchJoystick(int id,
                                     EventSource source)
        Get an IDispatchJoystick for the specified joystick ID. Joysticks 1-4 are joysticks attached to the driver station. Joystick 5 is the virtual Kinect left-arm joystick, and joystick 6 is the virtual Kinect right-arm joystick. The joystick will update the inputs and events when the specified event is fired.
        Parameters:
        id - the joystick ID, from 1 to 6, inclusive.
        source - when to update the joystick.
        Returns:
        the IDispatchJoystick.
        See Also:
        makeSimpleJoystick(int), makeDispatchJoystick(int)

      • makeJaguarMotor

        protected final FloatOutput makeJaguarMotor(int id,
                          boolean negate,
                          float ramping)
        Create a reference to a Jaguar speed controller on the specified ID and motor reversal, with a specified ramping rate. If the ramping rate is zero, then no ramping is applied. Don't use this if you don't know what you're doing! Otherwise, the ramping rate is the maximum difference allowed per 10 milliseconds (constantPeriodic). (So a rate of 0.1f means that you need 200 milliseconds to go from -1.0 to 1.0.)
        Parameters:
        id - the motor port ID, from 1 to 10, inclusive.
        negate - MOTOR_FORWARD if the motor should be unmodified, MOTOR_REVERSE if the motor should be reversed.
        ramping - the ramping rate.
        Returns:
        the output that will output to the specified motor.
        See Also:
        MOTOR_FORWARD, MOTOR_REVERSE

      • makeVictorMotor

        protected final FloatOutput makeVictorMotor(int id,
                          boolean negate,
                          float ramping)
        Create a reference to a Victor speed controller on the specified ID and motor reversal, with a specified ramping rate. If the ramping rate is zero, then no ramping is applied. Don't use this if you don't know what you're doing! Otherwise, the ramping rate is the maximum difference allowed per 10 milliseconds (constantPeriodic). (So a rate of 0.1f means that you need 200 milliseconds to go from -1.0 to 1.0.)
        Parameters:
        id - the motor port ID, from 1 to 10, inclusive.
        negate - MOTOR_FORWARD if the motor should be unmodified, MOTOR_REVERSE if the motor should be reversed.
        ramping - the ramping rate.
        Returns:
        the output that will output to the specified motor.
        See Also:
        MOTOR_FORWARD, MOTOR_REVERSE

      • makeTalonMotor

        protected final FloatOutput makeTalonMotor(int id,
                         boolean negate,
                         float ramping)
        Create a reference to a Talon speed controller on the specified ID and motor reversal, with a specified ramping rate. If the ramping rate is zero, then no ramping is applied. Don't use this if you don't know what you're doing! Otherwise, the ramping rate is the maximum difference allowed per 10 milliseconds (constantPeriodic). (So a rate of 0.1f means that you need 200 milliseconds to go from -1.0 to 1.0.)
        Parameters:
        id - the motor port ID, from 1 to 10, inclusive.
        negate - MOTOR_FORWARD if the motor should be unmodified, MOTOR_REVERSE if the motor should be reversed.
        ramping - the ramping rate.
        Returns:
        the output that will output to the specified motor.
        See Also:
        MOTOR_FORWARD, MOTOR_REVERSE

      • makeSolenoid

        protected final BooleanOutput makeSolenoid(int id)
        Create a reference to a solenoid on the specified port.
        Parameters:
        id - the port of the solenoid.
        Returns:
        the output that will control the solenoid.

                             int averageBits)
        Create a reference to an analog input on the specified port with the specified number of average bits.
        Parameters:
        id - the port number.
        averageBits - the number of averaging bits.
        Returns:
        the analog input, reporting in voltage.

        Parameters:

        averageBits - the number of averaging bits.
        Returns:

      • makeServo

        protected final FloatOutput makeServo(int id,
                    float minInput,
                    float maxInput)
        Create a reference to a servo controller for the specified port and minimum and maximum values.
        Parameters:
        id - the port number.
        minInput - the value on the output that should correspond to the servo's minimum position.
        maxInput - the value on the output that should correspond to the servo's maximum position.
        Returns:
        the FloatOutput that controls the servo.

      • makeDSFloatReadout

        protected final FloatOutput makeDSFloatReadout(java.lang.String prefix,
                             int line)
        Create an output that will display the current value on the driver station's LCD.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix, or label, of the output. this is prepended to the value.
        line - the line to display the value on, from 1 to 6.
        Returns:
        the output that will write to the LCD.

      • makeDSFloatReadout

        protected final void makeDSFloatReadout(java.lang.String prefix,
                      int line,
                      FloatInputPoll value,
                      EventSource when)
        Display the current value of the specified FloatInputPoll on the driver station's LCD, whenever the specified event is triggered.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix, or label, of the output. this is prepended to the value.
        line - the line to display the value on, from 1 to 6.
        value - the value to display.
        when - when to update the output.

      • sendDSUpdate

                int line)
        Send the specified string to the specified line of the driver station.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to display.
        line - The line number (1-6).

                       int compressorRelayChannel)
        Activate the compressor on the given pressure switch input and compressor relay channel.
        Parameters:

        compressorRelayChannel - the channel of the compressor's relay.

      • makeEncoder

        protected final FloatInputPoll makeEncoder(int aChannel,
                         int bChannel,
                         boolean reverse,
                         EventSource resetWhen)
        Create a reference to an Encoder on the specified ports with the specified number of average bits.
        Parameters:
        aChannel - The alpha-channel for the encoder.
        bChannel - The beta-channel for the encoder.
        reverse - Should the result of the encoder be negated?
        resetWhen - If provided, the Encoder's value will be reset when this event is produced.
        Returns:
        the Encoder, reporting encoder ticks.

      • makeEncoder

        protected final FloatInputPoll makeEncoder(int aChannel,
                         int bChannel,
                         boolean reverse)
        Create a reference to an Encoder on the specified ports with the specified number of average bits.
        Parameters:
        aChannel - The alpha-channel for the encoder.
        bChannel - The beta-channel for the encoder.
        reverse - Should the result of the encoder be negated?
        Returns:
        the Encoder, reporting encoder ticks.

      • makeForwardRelay

        protected final BooleanOutput makeForwardRelay(int channel)
        Create a reference to the Forward side of the relay on the specified channel - this side can be turned on and off.
        Parameters:
        channel - The relay channel.
        Returns:
        the output that will modify the forward side of the channel.

        Returns:
        the output that will modify the reverse side of the channel.
